title: 2.2 Enterprise Application Integration (EAI)

2.2 Enterprise Application Integration (EAI)

Overview

Enterprise Application Integration (EAI) is the process of linking multiple, independently developed applications within an organization to enable data sharing and streamline business processes.

Key Concepts

  • Data-Level Integration: Ensuring data consistency across systems.
  • Application-Level Integration: Connecting applications at the process or service level.
  • Method-Level Integration: Sharing business logic and methods across applications.

Common EAI Patterns

  • Point-to-Point Integration: Direct connections between applications.
  • Hub-and-Spoke Integration: A central hub manages communication between applications.
  • Message Bus Integration: Applications communicate through a shared message bus.

Benefits of EAI

  • Improved Data Visibility: Access to real-time data across the organization.
  • Streamlined Business Processes: Automation of tasks and workflows.
  • Reduced IT Complexity: Simplified integration landscape.
